Articles.Content: Doesn't work for me - when I delete the procedural parts copy, it completely breaks the scaling/textures/initial sizes of all procedural parts. If I replace the procedural parts KSPAPIExtensions.dll with the newer one from Tweakscale, it also breaks PP scaling, but initial sizes of PP tanks are correct. Sounds like it's a problem with PP, then, but would love to be able to have both work together - is removing that DLL the only thing you had to do to get it to work? Are you running any other mods too? Not sure what I'm doing wrong...

I did manage to get the TweakScale scale value in order to incorporate it into Infernal Robotics. Works well except the tweak UI doesn't refresh. Not a big deal but I'll see if there is a way for it to reload that.

Doesn't work for me - when I delete the procedural parts copy, it completely breaks the scaling/textures/initial sizes of all procedural parts. If I replace the procedural parts KSPAPIExtensions.dll with the newer one from Tweakscale, it also breaks PP scaling, but initial sizes of PP tanks are correct. Sounds like it's a problem with PP, then, but would love to be able to have both work together - is removing that DLL the only thing you had to do to get it to work? Are you running any other mods too? Not sure what I'm doing wrong...

The PreceduralParts.dll has to be build against the new KSPAPIExtensions.dll. I'm in the bad habit of doing that for myself to keep my many mods which use KSPAPIExtensions in sync.

The process itself is painless. Only be careful to use the source form the PP download and not the latest version from GitHub since that requires an even newer version of the KSPAPIExtensions.

If you don't know how that's done write me a PM and I'll send you the working dll. I just don't want do spread it around too much since I don't have permission to do that and it's always a dirty build without proper testing. Hope that's understandable.

Edited May 20, 2014 by marce

I've tried deleting procedural parts kspapiextensions.dll - made procedural parts unusable. When i have tweakscale installed i am also unable to choose textures for procedural parts in editor.

Not to be unreasonable, but I'm not gonna install all those mods to figure out which one gives you problems. As others have pointed out above, there are incompatibilities between Procedural Parts, Procedural Fairings and TweakScale. The sad fact is, they use incompatible versions of the KSPAPIExtensions library.

I tried recompiling all three with the newest version of KSPAPIExtension, and that works. But that's hardly a burden you can place on the average user. I'm not sure what rights I have to distribute it, but here are updated DLLs for all three. They seem to work for me.

[EDIT]swamp_ig has told me how things are supposed to work, and I find his logic impeccable. Please download and install TweakScale 1.5.0.1, where these problems seem to be fixed.[/EDIT]

Edited May 21, 2014 by Biotronic

I did manage to get the TweakScale scale value in order to incorporate it into Infernal Robotics. Works well except the tweak UI doesn't refresh. Not a big deal but I'll see if there is a way for it to reload that.

New version again. This time you can register your own IRescalable, which will be prodded every time something is rescaled.

New version again. This time you can register your own IRescalable, which will be prodded every time something is rescaled.

You sir are amazing. Can't wait to give this a try in an hour.
Would it be possible to add support to the KSO?

You sir are amazing. Can't wait to give this a try in an hour.

Remember to scale the speed as well as the min/max of telescopic pistons (not for gantries and rails though). It would be great if you could combine all 9 variants into a single tweakable part!

Would it be possible to add support to the KSO?

Done. Not including it before next version, though. Meanwhile, here's the .cfg.

[EDIT]New version is out. Check front page.[/EDIT]

Edited May 21, 2014 by Biotronic

You sir are amazing. Can't wait to give this a try in an hour.

It seems that IRescalable is not as fantastic as I first thought. Basically, it seems one'd need to put them in a separate dll from the main behavior. This is less than optimal, so I'm considering a different solution where one'd simply register a function. This is also less than optimal, but might be better.

It seems that IRescalable is not as fantastic as I first thought. Basically, it seems one'd need to put them in a separate dll from the main behavior. This is less than optimal, so I'm considering a different solution where one'd simply register a function. This is also less than optimal, but might be better.

Well let me know what I can do to help.

Running into an issue:

FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'KSPAPIExtensions, Version=1.4.3.12, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.

Version included in 1.5 is:

Yeah, 1.5 was a train wreck. And I just got a message bout KSPAPIExtensions which indicates I've misunderstood things. I now do agree with swamp_ig on where the file should reside.

Anwyays, new version is up. Grab it while it's hot.
Why are there two copies of KSPIPAExtensions?

Why are there two copies of KSPIPAExtensions?

Mostly because I'm stupid. Do I need more reasons?

[EDIT] Fixed the download[/EDIT]

From what little I can understand, it appears as though it is trying to be able to scale the plugin data from for the RPM support in KSO mod. Just an educated guess.

Do you have MechJeb and SCANsat installed? Those errors do not mention TweakScale at all, so I don't think it's the reason.

I did a test run without TweakScale and checked output_log.txt. I get the same messages you get, so it's not that. Try installing MechJeb and SCANsat and run the game anew.

I'm starting to think this is one of those days where I shouldn't have done a lot of releases...

The parts work in the VAB and show up, but the scaling doesn't show up, and the on the KSO the right click doesn't work.

The parts work in the VAB and show up, but the scaling doesn't show up, and the on the KSO the right click doesn't work.

1) Have you installed TweakScale 1.5.0.1?

2) Have you deleted KSPAPIExtensions.dll from Kerbal Space Program\Gamedata?

3) Does output_log.txt say anything whatsoever about TweakScale?

4) Not all parts have been made scalable. I belive everything under propulsion is, so try a few of those if you're unsure.

I've traced the error messages in your log to a combination of MechJeb, SCANsat and RasterPropMonitor. If you lack one or more of these, you will get error messages. If you don't use RPM and don't want the messages, delete both SCANsatRPM and MechJeb2RPM from your GameData folder. Same goes for MechJeb and SCANsat for their respective folders.

I have deleted the KSPAPIExtensions duplicate, and I don't have mechjeb installed I have no I sea why I thought that was it, my apologies for wasting your time. I saw that right after the TweakScale and assumed that was the problem, it seems to work now thank you for the plugin and again sorry for any trouble it may have caused, I need to remember to triple check bug reports before I post them. Can this mod scale command pods as well?

Edited May 21, 2014 by Robotengineer

Can this mod scale command pods as well?

Just to get a different scale, certainly. But it doesn't currently allow for more crew.
Not that you need another headache, but this new version still doesn't play nice with procedural parts =( Same effect as before.

I love what this mod can do. It's not working for me right now.

In a clean install of KSP, I can create new parts, scale them, and launch the vehicle. Everything works fine until I reload the craft in any way (reverting to launch, the VAB, saving and loading within the VAB). All the parts I've tested that use the meter scales (the inline Xenon tank, the massive booster) revert to their original size. Many of the parts that use percent scales (the radial Xenon tank, modular girders) retain their scaled sizes, while others revert (radial batteries, solar panels). They are saved correctly - the "currentScale" in the craft file is correct. I'm including a fairly minimal craft file the demonstrates the bug (6 rescaled parts, 3 revert, 3 don't). I've had the same problem with all the InfernalRobotics rework parts.

Let me know what I can do to help nail down this bug. Nothing pops out to me in the log file (no errors or warnings during while working with the crafts), but I can PM you one if you really think it will help.

Also, the Rockomax 48-7S section of the config needs a decimal point in the defaultScale. It says "defaultScale = 0625" and the tweakable says it's already 5m!
